University of Kentucky: The University of Kentucky (UK, UKY, or U of K) is a public land-grant research university in Lexington, Kentucky. Founded in 1865 by John Bryan Bowman as the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Kentucky,[9] the university is one of the state's two land-grant universities (the other being Kentucky State University).  It is the institution with the highest enrollment in the state, with 32,710 students in the fall of 2022.[10]
